basics.name: Oscar Zurita
basics.label: Electronics Engineer - Networking Administrator - Systems Administrator - Developer
basics.summary: An Electronics Engineer awarded for success in planning and operational improvements. An enthusiastic, self-motivated professional with a background in implementing and troubleshooting networking projects and security solutions with broad experience in Cisco Systems and Checkpoint products. As a Systems Administrator worked with different OS systems (Window, Linux, Unix)

work.name: Armstrong’s – An Avant Guard Monitoring Company. Edmonton, CANADA.
work.summary: Receive alarms and call clients and/or authorities if necessary. Receive calls and help users with security equipment. Report results. Document each event.

work.name: Colorado Geological Survey at the Colorado School of Mines. Denver, CO. USA.
work.summary: Designed and implemented the website and the architecture to communicate between field sensors and the server to collect data. Designed and implemented the system to show data of sensors in the website in Real-time. Developed a dynamic web page using D3 and MySQL.

work.name: Soil Water Retention. Denver, CO.USA.
work.summary: Designed a system to measure changes in soils through the design of a machine by a team of two civil engineers and myself. Developed the system in LabVIEW to manage the machine. Gave technical support after the product was delivered.

work.name: THASK – Technology Services – La Paz, BOLIVIA.
work.summary: Discussed project progress with customers with different backgrounds, collected feedback on different stages, and directly addressed concerns. Configured and managed networking solutions, security systems, intrusion detection systems, and operating systems (Cisco and Fortinet) during the first stages of the project.

work.name: Denver Center for 21st Century Learning. Denver, CO.
work.summary: Worked closely with Denver Public School IT department to improve the network’s school (Wireless and Wired) efficiency. Designed and maintained enhanced school servers (N-computing based), computers (Windows and macOS), printers, cables, and other equipment. Provided training to the teachers about new equipment and software that they use.

work.name: CRECER - Crédito con Educación Rural – La Paz, Bolivia.
work.summary: Led and directed a team of eleven people (network administrators, system administrator, and seven IT professionals). Prepared budget for new projects to fulfill requirements of other areas. Led meetings with departmental and national managers to review project status, propose changes, and draft action plans. Designed network, implemented, and maintained routers, switches, and firewalls. LAN (wire and wireless), WAN, VPN, and VoIP in a secure environment to connect more than 60 branches and headquarters with the primary office. Ensure all servers (including Unix, Linux, and Windows) were up and running during the service hours. Mentored junior engineers and new hires in my department to improve the competency and efficiency of all staff. Accurately documented user support activities, such as system problems, corrective actions, resolution status, and completed equipment installations. Designed the data center in the new building.

work.name: Mercantil Santa Cruz Bank – La Paz, Bolivia.
work.position: NETWORK AND TELECOMMUNICATION HEAD OF DEPARTMENT
work.summary: Led and directed a team of two network administrators and six IT professionals. Coordinated and implemented a VoIP project using AVAYA technology in 35 branch offices distributed in 9 headquarters. Monitored, investigated, and solved issues in the network. Provided daily network maintenance to include installation, configuration, operation and troubleshooting of the networks (LAN, WAN, VPN) with Cisco and Checkpoint products. Accurately documented user support activities, such as network problems, corrective actions, resolution status, and completed equipment installations. Participated in the design of a high-availability data center.

work.name: Central Bank of Bolivia– La Paz, Bolivia.
work.summary: Designed and installed a network to allow interbank transactions among the Central Bank and all private banks. (SIPAV Project). Performed system maintenance and upgrades, including patches and configurations. Researched and recommended network products, services, and standards for network developments. Maintained and monitored network hardware and software to ensure network optimal performance, availability, and reliability to end-users. Assisted in network security audits and performed mitigation plans.

work.name: Central Bank of Bolivia– La Paz, Bolivia.
work.summary: Designed and installed a network to allow interbank transactions among the Central Bank and all private banks. (SIPAV Project). Performed system maintenance and upgrades, including patches and configurations. Researched and recommended network products, services, and standards for network developments. Maintained and monitored network hardware and software to ensure network optimal performance, availability, and reliability to end-users. Assisted in network security audits and performed mitigation plans.

Outreach.position: Organized and co-led an English Conversation Club
Outreach.summary: Co-lead, organizer of the first English Conversation Club in YWCA-Bolivia.
highlights: We started with 6 students, and the last year we double it

courses: Analysis of the data network and design of a network perimeter for the Central Bank of Bolivia.

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
